intro: Peucedanum zeyheri, commonly known as Zeyher's angelica, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is fibrous and can be harvested for medicinal use, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of its family. Peucedanum zeyheri is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
